catalog_info.title: Introduction to Analytic Number Theory
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Knowledge of the material in Mathematics 113 and 123.
catalog_info.description: Fundamental methods, results, and problems of analytic number theory. Riemann zeta function and the Prime Number Theorem; Dirichlet's theorem on primes in arithmetic progressions; lower bounds on discriminants from functional equations; sieve methods, analytic estimates on exponential sums, and their applications.
